p: Enterolignans enterodiol and enterolactone, produced in the digestion track of mammals (see Section 2.2.3), affected gene expression in the liver in a similar way as their precursors matairesinol, pinoresinol and sesamin, and directly activated the estrogen signaling pathway [ 306]. Using a human breast cancer cell line with a reporter gene fusion for the estrogen response, Pianjing and coworkers [ 307] demonstrated that enterolactone, sesamin, sesamolin and sesamol possessed estrogenic activities. Sesamol, which is commercially available, possessed the highest activity, even higher than enterolactone.
